reasoning: NEW CUSTOMERS DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE OVERALL NET ADDS.
NEW CUSTOMERS CONTRIBUTE TO THE OVERALL REVENUE BASE, IMPACTING ARPA.
NEW CUSTOMERS' EXPERIENCE DIRECTLY IMPACTS NPS.
SERVICE QUALITY IMPACTS NEW CUSTOMER SATISFACTION AND CHURN.
AALS INDICATE CUSTOMER SATISFACTION, IMPACTING NPS.
SERVICE QUALITY IMPACTS AALS THROUGH CUSTOMER SATISFACTION.
PORT OUTS REDUCE REVENUE, IMPACTING ARPA.
PORT OUTS INDICATE CUSTOMER DISSATISFACTION, IMPACTING NPS.
POOR SERVICE MAY LEAD TO PORT OUTS.
PORT INS INCREASE REVENUE, IMPACTING ARPA.
PORT INS MAY INDICATE POSITIVE WORD-OF-MOUTH, IMPACTING NPS.
HIGH NPS LEADS TO HIGHER ARPU THROUGH INCREASED LOYALTY AND WILLINGNESS TO SPEND.
POOR SERVICE CAN NEGATIVELY IMPACT ARPA.
LONGER CALL HANDLING TIMES INDICATE POOR SERVICE, NEGATIVELY IMPACTING NPS.
NET ADDS REFLECT CUSTOMER SATISFACTION AND LOYALTY, IMPACTING NPS.
SERVICE QUALITY IMPACTS CUSTOMER ACQUISITION AND RETENTION, AFFECTING NET ADDS.
